title: Why Disney on Ice could freeze downtown traffic
text:

Disney on Ice: 100 Years of Magic is running two shows a day through the weekend. Check out this story on 11alive.com: http://on.11alive.com/1RydVqp Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Why Disney on Ice could freeze downtown traffic Atlanta Pride includes 2 marches and a parade this weekend. Crash Clark breaks down how it will effect traffic. Julie Wolfe, WXIA 1:22 p.m. EDT October 9, 2015 "Disney on Ice" FILE. 1 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ATLANTA -- It's a perfect storm of tiaras and taffeta in downtown Atlanta this weekend. Disney on Ice: 100 Years of Magic has multiple shows a day through the weekend. Atlanta Pride is organizing three marches and parades that will shut down streets in the downtown area. The largest of these events, the Atlanta Pride Parade, is Sunday afternoon. It starts at exactly the same time as the kickoff to the Atlanta Falcons game with the Washington Redskins. 
The Atlanta Pride Parade route (Photo: 11Alive News) 
Atlanta Pride organizers have been meeting with city leaders about traffic plans. Street closures for the parade will start at 10:00 a.m. on Sunday. It's a rolling closure following the route through downtown and Midtown. As part of those meetings, Pride leaders promised to urge participants and spectators to ride MARTA and avoid the congested area. There will also be signs along the interstate urging traffic for the Georgia Dome and Phillips Arena NOT to take the Williams Street exit. Guide to Pride 2015 
Disney on Ice ticket-holders include a lot of customers outside of MARTA's footprint. Historically, most of them drive themselves and park near the event. The costume-clad kids and their parents fill nearby surface lots and sidewalks on their way to the event.
